Systematic Design for Emergence in Cellular Nonlinear Networks: With Applications in Natural Computing and Signal Processing
@inproceedings{Dogaru2008SystematicDF,
  title={Systematic Design for Emergence in Cellular Nonlinear Networks: With Applications in Natural Computing and Signal Processing},
  author={Radu Dogaru},
  booktitle={Studies in Computational Intelligence},
  year={2008},
  url={https://api.semanticscholar.org/CorpusID:11324296}
}R. Dogaru
Published in Studies in Computational... 11 March 2008
Computer Science, Engineering
TLDR


This book proposes a systematic framework for measuring emergence and a systematic design method to locate computationally meaningful genes in a reasonable computing time.Expand

Fast Selection of Cellular Automata Genes Based on Uncertainty Profiles of Cells
R. DogaruShi WangHyongsuk KimComputer Science
GEM
2008
TLDR


A synthetic descriptor called an uncertainty profile is easily computed given the binary CA gene and a description of the neighborhood connectivity, so a selection of the most interesting CA genes can be easily done, outperforming any other optimization method based on simulating the CA and evaluation of an objective function.Expand
1

Highly Influenced

PDF



6 Excerpts


Save





A Fast Method for Classification of Emergent Dynamics in Cellular Automata Based on Uncertainty Profiles
R. DogaruComputer Science
2009
TLDR


A new and efficient method to classify cellular automata (ECA) with 3 cells neighborhood that is extremely fast since it does not require the simulation of the cellular automaton dynamics and all classification process is based on a uncertainty profile computed rapidly for a given cell logic and neighborhood.Expand
1

Highly Influenced


8 Excerpts


Save





APPLICATIONS OF NATURAL COMPUTING IN CRYPTOLOGY: NLFSR BASED ON HYBRID CELLULAR AUTOMATA WITH 5-CELL NEIGHBORHOOD
R. DogaruI. DogaruComputer Science, Mathematics
2013
TLDR


It is proved that the HCA are in fact nonlinear feedback shift registers NLFSR, recently gaining increasingly interest for cryptographic applications (such as stream ciphers), and that the FPGA resources are optimally allocated as a consequence of using the ANF representation of cells.Expand
3

PDF



1 Excerpt


Save





Dynamics of cellular automata with input: basis for a systematic study
G. E. PazienzaT. RoskaComputer Science, Engineering
Int. J. Circuit Theory Appl.
2012
TLDR


This paper proposes a methodology to analyze thoroughly and rigorously the CA with input, and provides an accurate simulator for experimental purposes.Expand
1 Excerpt


Save





A Python Framework for Fast Modelling and Simulation of Cellular Nonlinear Networks and other Finite-difference Time-domain Systems
R. DogaruI. DogaruComputer Science, Engineering
2021 23rd International Conference on Control...
2021
TLDR


A freely available cellular nonlinear network simulator optimized for the effective use of GPUs, to achieve fast modelling and simulations for slow-growth phenomena as well as for various image processing applications such as edge detection.Expand
2

[PDF]
1 Excerpt


Save





A Low Cost High Performance Computing Platform for Cellular Nonlinear Networks Using Python for CUDA
R. DogaruI. DogaruComputer Science, Engineering
2015 20th International Conference on Control...
2015
TLDR


It is shown that the hardware resources are effectively exploited while using a programming style closer to scientific computing and with a short learning cycle, and the platform can be easily extended to support a broader spectrum of computational models similar to CNNs.Expand
8


1 Excerpt


Save





Applications of Emergent Computation in Reaction-Diffusion CNNs for Image Processing
R. DogaruComputer Science
2013 19th International Conference on Control...
2013
TLDR


It is shown that by implementing a simplified discrete-time model and by using the local activity theory to locate potentially useful regions in the huge parameter space, many useful image processing tasks may be performed in reasonable execution time.Expand
5

PDF



Save





Cellular Automata for Efficient Image and Video Compression
R. DogaruI. DogaruComputer Science
2014
This chapter focuses on applications of cellular automata for image and video compression leading to high efficiency implementations (i.e. relatively simple operators and algorithms, and extra... Expand

Emergence phenomena in self-organizing systems: a systematic literature review of concepts, researches, and future prospects
Somayeh KalantariE. NazemiB. MasoumiComputer Science
J. Organ. Comput. Electron. Commer.
2020
TLDR


This study shows that much research had been done not only in computer science but also in other sciences on emergence, and there is a need to provide new methods for identifying, measuring, verifying, modeling, simulating, predicting, and controlling emergence in future research.Expand
19


1 Excerpt


Save





Complexity Index of Outer-Totalistic Binary Cellular Automata with Arbitrary Dimension and Neighborhood
G. E. PazienzaE. Gómez-RamírezComputer Science, Mathematics
Int. J. Bifurc. Chaos
2012
TLDR


This paper first introduces a complexity index for outer-totalistic binary CA with arbitrary dimension and neighborhood by means of a rigorous mathematical theory, and proposes a method to find it easily, given only the truth table of an outer- totalistic binaryCA rule.Expand
